com.defano.jmonet.canvas.observable

Interface SurfaceInteractionObserver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventListener, KeyListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBoundsTool, AbstractLineTool, AbstractPathTool, AbstractPolylineTool, AbstractSelectionTool, AbstractTransformTool, AirbrushTool, ArrowTool, CurveTool, EraserTool, FillTool, FreeformShapeTool, LassoTool, LineTool, MagnifierTool, OvalTool, PaintbrushTool, PaintTool, PencilTool, PerspectiveTool, PolygonTool, ProjectionTool, RectangleTool, RotateTool, RoundRectangleTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SelectionTool, ShapeTool, SlantTool, TextTool

    public interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
extends KeyListener
    An observer of mouse and keyboard events taking place on a ScalableLayeredPainting. Converts mouse events to the coordinate space of the image represented by the ScalableLayeredPainting.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • mouseClicked

        void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e,
                  Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when the mouse button has been clicked (pressed and released) on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseDragged

        void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                  Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseMoved

        void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e,
                Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when the mouse cursor has been moved onto a component but no buttons have been pushed.
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred
